metadata.name: Azure Suppression Rule Created
metadata.comment: Identifies when a suppression rule is created in Azure. Adversary's could attempt this to evade detection.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM entity_management WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (activity_id = 1 AND lower(api.operation) = lower('microsoft.security/alertssuppressionrules/write'))

output.summary: Identifies when a suppression rule is created in Azure. Adversary's could attempt this to evade detection.

metadata.objective: False positives: 1. Suppression Rule being created may be performed by a system administrator. 2. Verify whether the user identity, user agent, and/or hostname should be making changes in your environment. 3. Suppression Rule created from unfamiliar users should be investigated. If known behavior is causing false positives, it can be exempted from the rule. Reference: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/role-based-access-control/resource-provider-operations
